Industrijska cona Beti oživlja
03 Nov 2019, 10:30 by M. Bezek Jakše
Metlika - Beti iz Metlike je bila v metliški industrijski coni Beti lastnica 30.000 m2 pokritih površin. Zdaj Beti, ki ji je od vse proizvodnje ostala le proizvodnja preje, uporablja še polovico teh površin. Poleg prostorov preje ima v uporabi še prostore nekdanje kodranke in pletilnice. Ker so prazni prostori podjetje močno bremenili, so letos veliko pozornosti namenili oglaševanju prodaje.
Njihov cilj je bil, da prodajo ali dajo v dolgotrajni najem vse prostore, ki jih ne potrebujejo več. Kot je povedala izvršna direktorica Beti Maja Čibej, je bil odziv kar dober. »Število podjetij, ki so našla prostore za proizvodnjo v naši coni, se giblje okrog osem. Nekatera so lastniki, druga najemniki. Veseli smo, da so med njimi tudi firme, ki se širijo, na primer Špica in Arex-orodjarna, in da industrijska cona oživlja. Tako so na degradiranem območju, ki meri 0,75 ha, zasedeni skoraj vsi prostori, zdaj pa si prizadevamo prodati še nekdanji šivalnico in barvarno,« je dejala Čibejeva.
Težava, ki nekatere še odvrača od nakupa, pa je, da je treba v industrijski coni Beti urediti javne poti, javno vodovodno in kanalizacijsko omrežje ter elektroomrežje. Da pa bi to uredili, bodo morali zaradi gručaste in strnjene pozidave nekatere dele objektov odstraniti. Agencija za okolje je nedavno sklenila, da jim za to naložbo ni treba pridobiti okoljevarstvenega soglasja, saj je ocenila, da se s posegi v prostor ne bo poslabšala kakovost podzemnih ali površinskih voda.


Degradirano območje bodo začeli obnavljati na začetku prihodnjega leta.Foto: M. B. J.

V industrijski coni namerava občina zgraditi 463 metrov mešane kanalizacije, 717 metrov vodovoda, 290 metrov elektro-kabelske kanalizacije, 120 metrov dostopne ceste in 70 metrov interne ceste. Vsi novi vodi se bodo navezovali na že obstoječo infrastrukturo.
Kot je povedal metliški župan Darko Zevnik, metliška občina ureja industrijsko cono Beti, ker je dolžna zagotavljati razvoj gospodarstva. »Z ministrstvom za gospodarstvo smo podpisali pogodbo glede sofinanciranja. Celotna naložba bo stala 730.000 evrov, vendar bosta 500.000 evrov zagotovili EU in država, ostalo pa občina. V kratkem bo objavljen razpis za izvajalca. Dela naj bi začeli na začetku prihodnjega leta in jih končali v letu dni. Za vložek, ki ga bo prispevala občina, bo dobila športna igrišča, zemljišča, kjer bo prometna in komunalna infrastruktura, in objekt, v katerem so depoji Belokranjskega muzeja Metlika, za katere zdaj plačujemo najemnino,« je pojasnil Zevnik.
Ob tem je dodal, da je pogoj za ureditev degradiranega območja, da mora biti do konca investicije prodanih 70 odst. objektov v njem, a kot je potrdila Čibejeva, je že zdaj prodanega več. Opaža, da je predvsem letos več povpraševanja za Betine prostore, v glavnem pa se zanimajo zanje lokalna podjetja, ki želijo ostati v domačem okolju.
Sicer pa je izvršna direktorica povedala, da so lani v Beti poslovali zelo dobro, saj so po nekaj letih presegli deset milijonov evrov realizacije. Letos pa, kot vse kaže, bodo prodali za nekaj odstotkov manj, ker že občutijo ohlajanje gospodarstva. A kljub temu pričakujejo pozitiven rezultat. »95 odst. proizvodnje izvozimo, zadnja leta pa se vse bolj usmerjamo na trge v srednji in severni Evropi, kjer povečujemo prodajo. Čeprav je bila pri nas kakovost vedno dobra, pa prav ti evropski kupci zahtevajo vedno boljšo in boljšo prejo. Zato imamo velike potrebe po investicijah, saj bomo le tako lahko še povečali kakovost in produktivnost. Ne nazadnje so tudi naši stroji že precej dotrajani. Ocenjujemo, da se bodo v prihodnjem letu stroški dela pri nas zvišali za 10 do 15 odst., kar pa kupca ne zanima. Vendar za naložbe potrebujemo denar, v slabi banki pa zahtevajo, da odplačujemo pretekle dolgove, in brez njenega soglasja se ne moremo podati v naložbe, ki so večje od 100.000 evrov,« je še predstavila Čibejeva.

Članek je bil objavljen v 41. številki Dolenjskega lista.

The Betty Industrial Zone is coming to life
03 Nov 2019, 10:30 by M. Bezek Jakse
Metlika - Beti from Metlika owned 30,000 m2 of covered land in the Beti Metallic Industrial Area. Now Beti, with only yarn left over from production, uses half of these areas. In addition to the premises of the yarn, it also has the premises of former curtains and knitting machines. As the vacant space was heavily burdened by the company, much attention was paid this year to advertising sales.
Their goal was to sell or rent long-term premises that they no longer needed. Beti's executive director Maja Cibej said the response was good. “The number of companies that have found production facilities in our zone is around eight. Some are owners, others are tenants. We are pleased to see that expanding companies, such as Spica and Arex-tool shops, are among them and that the industrial zone is reviving. Thus, in the degraded area, measuring 0.75 ha, almost all the premises are occupied, and now we are trying to sell the former sewing and painting shop, ”said Chibeva.
However, a problem that discourages some people from purchasing is that public roads, public water supply and sewerage networks and electrical networks need to be regulated in the Beti industrial zone. However, in order to remedy this, some parts of the building will have to be removed due to the clumpy and compacted construction. The Environment Agency recently concluded that they do not need to obtain environmental approval for this investment, as it assessed that the interventions in the space will not impair the quality of groundwater or surface water.


The degraded area will be restored at the beginning of next year. Photo: M. B. J.

In the industrial zone, the municipality plans to construct 463 meters of mixed sewage, 717 meters of water supply, 290 meters of electric cable sewage, 120 meters of access road and 70 meters of internal road. All new lines will be linked to existing infrastructure.
According to Mayor Darko Zevnik of Metlika, the municipality of Metlika regulates the Beti industrial zone because it is obliged to ensure the development of the economy. “We signed a co-financing agreement with the Ministry of the Economy. The total investment will cost € 730,000, but € 500,000 will be provided by the EU and the state and the rest by the municipality. A call for contractors will be announced shortly. Work is expected to begin early next year and be completed within a year. It will receive sports fields, land with transport and communal infrastructure, and a facility that houses the deposits of the Metlika Museum in Belokranj, for which the contribution is now being paid, "Zevnik explained.
He added that the condition for the regulation of the degraded area is that 70 percent of the land must be sold by the end of the investment. facilities, but as Chibeev confirmed, more have already been sold. He notes that there is more demand for Betta's premises this year, but mainly for local businesses that want to stay in their home environment.
The executive director also said that they did very well in Beta last year, after exceeding ten million euros in realization after a few years. This year, however, it seems that they will sell for a few percent less because they already feel the cooling of the economy. Nevertheless, they expect a positive result. »95 para. We are exporting production, and in recent years we are increasingly focusing on markets in Central and Northern Europe, where we are increasing sales. Although quality has always been good in our country, these European customers are demanding better and better yarns. That is why we have great investment needs, as this will only increase the quality and productivity. Last but not least, our machines are already quite worn out. We estimate that in the coming year, labor costs in our country will increase by 10 to 15 percent, which the buyer is not interested in. However, we need money to make investments, and in a bad bank they require us to pay off our past debts, and without our consent we cannot make investments in excess of € 100,000, ”Chibeva added.

The article was published in the 41st issue of Dolenjski list.
